name: Search queries or URLs
description: Bing Search queries (e.g. food in NYC) and/or full URLs (e.g. https://www.bing.com/search?q=food+NYC). Enter one item per field.

name: Results per page
description: Number of search results per page. By default, Bing Search returns 10 results. The allowed values are between 1 and 100.

name: Max pages per query
description: The maximum number of search result pages crawled for each search query or URL. Note that a value greater than one might significantly slow down the actor.

name: Market Code
description: Bing Search returns content for set market.

name: CSV friendliness
description: Remove results that are not CSV friendly.

name: Set up your proxy configuration
description: Automatic proxy and the country of your choice is usually the best option, but you can also select specific proxies, or use your own custom proxies.

name: Max concurrency
description: The maximum number of search results pages the crawler will load in parallel. A higher number means you will get your results faster, but also it will burn through your available proxies quicker.
